title: Rust doesn't pass -ldl when dladdr (and others) are used

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Recently in Fedora we enabled `-z defs` which is turning on:

```
     defs
        Report unresolved symbol references from regular object files.
        This is done even if the linker is creating a non-symbolic
        shared library.  This option is the inverse of -z undefs.
```

I've tried to build librsvg which is making static library from crate and it fails with:

```
*** Warning: Linking the shared library librsvg-2.la against the
*** static library /home/brain/Projects/fedora/rpms/librsvg2/librsvg-2.42.1/rust/target/release/librsvg_internals.a is not portable!
/home/brain/Projects/fedora/rpms/librsvg2/librsvg-2.42.1/rust/target/release/librsvg_internals.a(rsvg_internals-b823acfb4918fe68.rsvg_internals0.rcgu.o): In function `std::sys::imp::backtrace::printing::dladdr::resolve_symname<closure>':
/builddir/build/BUILD/rustc-1.23.0-src/src/libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/printing/dladdr.rs:25: undefined reference to `dladdr'
/builddir/build/BUILD/rustc-1.23.0-src/src/libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/printing/dladdr.rs:25: undefined reference to `dladdr'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

It seems that rust doesn't pass `-ldl` when it's dl* functions are used.
